text: Morton J. "Chuck" Mills (December 1, 1928 â€“ January 18, 2021) was an American college football coach. Mills was born in Chicago, Illinois. His career lasted from 1957 to 1997. He was the head coach at Pomona College, Indiana University of Pennsylvania, the United States Merchant Marine Academy, Utah State University, Wake Forest University, Southern Oregon University, and the United States Coast Guard Academy. Mills died on January 18, 2021 in Honolulu, Hawaii from pneumonia caused by multiple organ failure, aged 92. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:American football coaches Category:Sportspeople from Chicago
title: Chuck Mills
